description: Officially opened by Mayor Joy Belmonte on January 26, 2025, this is a newly rehabilitated four-storey structure. It features modernized classroom facilities and was part of the city's "New Year, New School" initiative.
This is one of the foundational academic buildings on the campus. It typically houses standard classrooms for Junior High School students.

Constructed in 2009 under the administration of Mayor Feliciano "Sonny" Belmonte. It was added to accommodate the rapidly increasing student population from the surrounding San Bartolome and Bagbag areas.
Constructed in 2013 during the administration of Mayor Herbert Bautista. Like the SB buildings, it was built to further expand the school's capacity for its thousands of learners.

The original Mathay Building was demolished in 2018. It was replaced with a larger, modern multi-storey structure specifically designed to support the introduction of Senior High School courses, including specialized tracks like Academic and Technical-Vocational-Livelihood (TVL).
A multi-purpose covered gymnasium facility that serves as the main venue for sports activities, physical education classes, and school events.
